meanings.definition: The ability to conduct electricity or heat.
meanings.sent1: The conductibility of the metal wire allowed electricity to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: The conductibility of the copper wire made it ideal for conducting heat in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The conductibility of the material was so high that it started conducting heat even before touching the flame.
meanings.sent4: Her conductibility in the kitchen was like a well-oiled machine, efficiently transferring heat from the stove to the pot.
meanings.sent5: The conductibility of the wire was so impressive that it became the talk of the science fair.

meanings.sent1: The conductibility of the material was evident in its ability to conduct electricity.
meanings.sent2: The conductibility of the substance was tested by measuring its ability to conduct heat.
meanings.sent3: His conductibility in solving puzzles was unmatched, showing his quick grasp of new concepts.
meanings.sent4: The conductibility of her leadership was like a magnet, attracting others to follow her guidance.
meanings.sent5: The conductibility of the fabric was so remarkable that it became a sought-after material in the industry.
